page.title: 18PORTHMADOG THE COB
page.content: The{Cob}is a dry stone embankment built 1808-1811 across the Glaslyn estuary by{W.A.Madocks}local landowner and MP for Boston,Lincs. to reclaim 3000 acres of land from the sea.It is 1600yds long,21ft high and 90ft wide at its base,tapering to 18ft.It cost Â£60000.Boston Lodge,a barracks for the navvies,was established on the E shore. The diversion of the river channel enabled the{harbour}to be opened in 1824 for the export of slates and in 1836 the{Festiniog Rly was opened to ease the transport of slates from the quarries to the harbour.The FR established its works at{Boston Lodge}where it developed from simple stables for the horses to a fully integrated workshop capable of building complete locomotives.The export of slates declined after 1914 and the railway closed in 1946.
